title: FPS deterioration
body: This is the 2nd time this has happened to me, basically ill join a game and over time ill go from 300+ fps down to 10 fps by about 10 minutes and i opened a ticket about it the first time it happened about 3 months ago as it lasted for over a week then all of a sudden it randomly stopped. back then i had all the tests done and the person helping me was of no help as i didnt believe it was my computer being the issue because i play many other games and have no issues with it but now its begun again and im sick of it. also if i restart the client mid game the process repeats itself

replies.body:
FPS issues often *are* on your end. It's usually a result of something conflicting with League in your specific setup, so it can be very difficult to nail down. At the very least it's usually your client, not *the* client, so if you were adamant that it wasn't on your end it is unsurprising that you never found a solution.

Try to remember anything new on your PC since the issue has started again, if something lines up, that's probably the conflict.

Update everything, no matter how unrelated it seems. Graphics drivers are the first thing to check for sure, but even if you have a dumb java update or something do that (or at least close it) as well.

If you have any overlays like Overwolf or even Discord overlay, disable them, and see if it fixes the issue.

Try closing everything else while playing League, if it fixes the issue, then something there is conflicting.

Try turning "close client while in game" on and see if that helps.

Try disabling V-sync, since that can also sometimes cause fps issues.

Hey, Chris from Overwolf here. 
Overwolf shouldn't cause any FPS drops and if it does we'd love to hear about it. We are all gamers here and this is extremely important to us.

I would recommend to try and disable Overwolf / Discord overlay (one at a time) and see how it affects your FPS in game. If while running only Overwolf with the game you still experience FPS drops, you're more than welcome to contact our support team and we'll have a look!

I recently came across this thread so it might be the case for you too: https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support/PIEAhqwc-fps-drop-fix?show=nested

It was mostly an example :P I've had issues with Overwolf gif highlights conflicting with geforce somewhere and causing issues, but it was more a general "disable anything interfacing with league and see if it's fixed" kinda thing. Overwolf was just what first came to mind.
